intro: Hesperis galleotiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Hesperis galleotiana is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
